I'm having a remarkable amount of trouble setting the figure size for saving a plot. All I want is the equivalent of `set(gcf, 'PaperPosition', [0 0 8 8])` from matlab. Something to mean that my figures when saved to file are the same size, so i can read them into a latex document. This seems to be an absolute rabbit hole though: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/plots-jl-set-figure-size-for-latex-publications/36960/2>

They there in suggest PGFPlotsX, (which I admit I do really like the idea of), but its very tricky to find what the required installation steps are from the package page. I have a functioning lualatex (I'm already using it!) Has anyone had any luck in getting it set up?

attachments.title: Plots.jl set figure size for LaTeX publications
attachments.text: A way to achieve this is using the pgfplots backend to save the figure into a tikzpicture. Instead of adjusting the size before you produce the plot, you can adjust the size in the generated .tex file. By using the package pgfplots in LaTeX, the plot will be drawn directly in the PDF, where you can adjust the size, fonts, colors, and any other property you can think of.
